member.name: T:FusionCharts.Charts.Chart
member.summary: Contains static methods to render FusionCharts in the Page.

member.name: M:FusionCharts.Charts.Chart.#ctor
member.summary: Chart constructor Chart configuration parameters can be supplyed to the constructor also.

member.summary: Chart constructor

member.summary: Chart constructor
member.param: The type of chart that you intend to plot
Id for the chart, using which it will be recognized in the HTML page. Each chart on the page needs to have a unique Id.

member.name: M:FusionCharts.Charts.Chart.Clone
member.summary: Public method to clone an exiting FusionCharts instance To make the chartId unique, this function will add "_clone" as suffix in the clone chart's Id.

member.name: M:FusionCharts.Charts.Chart.SetChartParameter(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: SetConfiguration sets various configurations of FusionCharts It takes configuration names as first parameter and its value a second parameter There are config groups which can contain common configuration names. All config names in all groups gets set with this value unless group is specified explicitly
member.param: Name of configuration
Value of configuration

member.name: M:FusionCharts.Charts.Chart.boolToNum(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Transform the meaning of boolean value in integer value
member.param: true/false value to be transformed
member.returns: 1 if the value is true, 0 if the value is false

member.name: T:FusionCharts.Charts.Chart.ChartParameter
member.summary: User configurable chart parameter list

member.name: T:FusionCharts.Charts.Chart.DataFormat
member.summary: List of supported data formats

member.name: T:InfoSoftGlobal.FusionCharts

M:InfoSoftGlobal.FusionCharts.RenderChartALL(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generate html code for rendering chart This function assumes that you've already included the FusionCharts JavaScript class in your page
member.param: SWF File Name (and Path) of the chart which you intend to plot
If you intend to use dataURL method for this chart, pass the URL as this parameter. Else, set it to "" (in case of dataXML method)
If you intend to use dataXML method for this chart, pass the XML data as this parameter. Else, set it to "" (in case of dataURL method)
Id for the chart, using which it will be recognized in the HTML page. Each chart on the page needs to have a unique Id.
Intended width for the chart (in pixels)
Intended height for the chart (in pixels)
Whether to start the chart in debug mode
Whether to ask chart to register itself with JavaScript
Whether allowTransparent chart (true / false)
Back Ground Color
Set Scale Mode
Set SWF file Language
member.returns: JavaScript + HTML code required to embed a chart

member.name: M:InfoSoftGlobal.FusionCharts.RenderChartHTMLALL(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Renders the HTML code for the chart. This method does NOT embed the chart using JavaScript class. Instead, it uses direct HTML embedding. So, if you see the charts on IE 6 (or above), you'll see the "Click to activate..." message on the chart.
member.param: SWF File Name (and Path) of the chart which you intend to plot
If you intend to use dataURL method for this chart, pass the URL as this parameter. Else, set it to "" (in case of dataXML method)
If you intend to use dataXML method for this chart, pass the XML data as this parameter. Else, set it to "" (in case of dataURL method)
Id for the chart, using which it will be recognized in the HTML page. Each chart on the page needs to have a unique Id.
Intended width for the chart (in pixels)
Intended height for the chart (in pixels)
Whether to start the chart in debug mode
Whether to ask chart to register itself with JavaScript
Whether allowTransparent chart (true / false)
Back Ground Color
Set Scale Mode
Set SWF file Language

member.param: SWF File Name (and Path) of the chart which you intend to plot

Id for the chart, using which it will be recognized in the HTML page. Each chart on the page needs to have a unique Id.

member.name: M:InfoSoftGlobal.FusionCharts.RenderChartHTML(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Renders the HTML code for the chart. This method does NOT embed the chart using JavaScript class. Instead, it uses direct HTML embedding. So, if you see the charts on IE 6 (or above), you'll see the "Click to activate..." message on the chart.
member.param: SWF File Name (and Path) of the chart which you intend to plot
If you intend to use dataURL method for this chart, pass the URL as this parameter. Else, set it to "" (in case of dataXML method)
If you intend to use dataXML method for this chart, pass the XML data as this parameter. Else, set it to "" (in case of dataURL method)
Id for the chart, using which it will be recognized in the HTML page. Each chart on the page needs to have a unique Id.
Intended width for the chart (in pixels)
Intended height for the chart (in pixels)
Whether to start the chart in debug mode

Id for the chart, using which it will be recognized in the HTML page. Each chart on the page needs to have a unique Id.

member.name: M:InfoSoftGlobal.FusionCharts.EncodeDataURL(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: encodes the dataURL before it's served to FusionCharts If you have parameters in your dataURL, you'll necessarily need to encode it
member.param: dataURL to be fed to chart
Whether to add aditional string to URL to disable caching of data
member.returns: Encoded dataURL, ready to be consumed by FusionCharts

member.name: M:InfoSoftGlobal.FusionCharts.EnablePrintManager
member.summary: Enables Print Manager for Mozilla browsers This function returns a small JavaScript snippet which can be added to ClientScript's RegisterClientScriptBlock method

member.name: M:InfoSoftGlobal.FusionCharts.EnablePrintManager(System.Object)
member.summary: Enables Print Manager for Mozilla browsers
member.param: Current page reference

member.name: M:InfoSoftGlobal.FusionCharts.SetDataFormat(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the dataformat to be provided to charts (json/xml)
member.param: Data format. Default is 'xml'. Other format is 'json'

member.name: M:InfoSoftGlobal.FusionCharts.SetRenderer(System.String)
member.summary: Sets renderer type (flash/javascript)
member.param: Name of the renderer. Default is 'flash'. Other possibility is 'javascript'

member.name: M:InfoSoftGlobal.FusionCharts.SetWindowMode(System.String)
member.summary: Explicitely sets window mode (window[detault]/transpatent/opaque)
member.param: Name of the mode. Default is 'window'. Other possibilities are 'transparent'/'opaque'

member.name: M:InfoSoftGlobal.FusionCharts.SetConfiguration(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: FC_SetConfiguration sets various configurations of FusionCharts It takes configuration names as first parameter and its value a second parameter There are config groups which can contain common configuration names. All config names in all groups gets set with this value unless group is specified explicitly
member.param: Name of configuration
Value of configuration

member.name: M:InfoSoftGlobal.FusionCharts.SetConfiguration(System.Collections.Hashtable@,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: FC_SetConfiguration sets various configurations of FusionCharts It takes configuration names as first parameter and its value a second parameter There are config groups which can contain common configuration names. All config names in all groups gets set with this value unless group is specified explicitly
member.param: Name of configuration
Value of configuration

member.name: M:InfoSoftGlobal.FusionCharts.boolToNum(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Transform the meaning of boolean value in integer value
member.param: true/false value to be transformed
member.returns: 1 if the value is true, 0 if the value is false
